snippet: Evgeny Nikitin, who withdrew from the Bayreuth Festival after he was reported to have a swastikalike tattoo on his chest, said on Tuesday that the tattoo had nothing to do with Nazis.
abstract: Russian bass-baritone Evgeny Nikitin, who resigned from production of Wagner's Flying Dutchman at the Bayreuth Festival after he was reported to have a swastika-like tattoo on his chest, explains that his controversial body art was never meant to resemble the Nazi symbol; will be starring in seven performances of Wagner's Parsifal at the Metropolitan Opera in early 2013.
lead_paragraph: Evgeny Nikitin, who withdrew from the Bayreuth Festival after he was reported to have a swastikalike tattoo on his chest, said on Tuesday that the tattoo had nothing to do with Nazis.

headline.seo: Opera Singer Explains Tattoo Thought to Be Swastika
